titleStmt.title: Great Britaines sorrow for the death of her late deceased all beloued soueraigne lord King James who dyed at his manour of Theobalds, on Sunday, March 27. 1625. and the peoples ioy in the welcome proclaiming of his vndoubted sonne, and our leige lord Charles King of Great Britaine, France and Ireland, &c.
Great Britaines sorrow for the death of her late deceased all beloved soveraigne lord King James.

Great Britaines sorrow for the death of her late deceased all beloued soueraigne lord King James who dyed at his manour of Theobalds, on Sunday, March 27. 1625. and the peoples ioy in the welcome proclaiming of his vndoubted sonne, and our leige lord Charles King of Great Britaine, France and Ireland, &c.
Great Britaines sorrow for the death of her late deceased all beloved soveraigne lord King James.

notesStmt.note: Verse - "Here are two figures of great griefe and ioy".
Identified as STC 14423a on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
